summary: The Bureau of Indian Education oversees the Johnson O'Malley Program, which provides educational services for American Indian and Alaska Native students—such as language enrichment and buying school supplies. This Q&A report looks at the steps the Bureau took, or plans to take, to update its count of students and allocate funding for the program. In 2018, Congress required the Bureau to estimate the number of...
title: Bureau of Indian Education: Information on Efforts to Count Students for an Educational Services Program
